title: Brooklyn Tequila and Spirits Fest
description: Discover, sip, and savor tequila and mezcal at Industry City with over 100 styles available, paired with live music and delicious food.
address: Industry City, 33 35th Street, Suite 52A, Brooklyn, NY 11232

title: Prospect Park Ice Skating
description: Skating season returns to Prospect Park's lakeside’s rink. $10.60-15.25 admission, $10.35 skate rental (or byo), $5.45-14.15 locker rental/bag check.

title: New York Comedy Festival
description: More than 200 comedians perform in more than 100 shows at venues throughout the five boroughs. Some skint-priced options this week include various shows.

title: Ice Theatre of New York: 2024-25 City Skate Pop-Up Performances
description: Professional ice dance company Ice Theatre of New York brings a series of short, free performances to public outdoor rinks through the season. This year’s season kicks off at Bryant Park.

title: Heartbreak is the National Anthem: How Taylor Swift Reinvented Pop Music with Rob Sheffield
description: Author and Rolling Stone journalist Rob Sheffield shares his new book on the life, music, and cultural impact of Taylor Swift in a conversation with Rolling Stone writer Brittany Spanos at Brooklyn Brewery.
cost: $10 admission, $36 ticket includes a copy of the book

title: Live Band Karaoke at Arlene’s Grocery
description: Choose from over 175 rock and pop songs and sing with your very own live band backing you up at Arlene’s Grocery.
address: Arlene's Grocery, LES, New York, NY

title: Miss Hole World: A Hole Tribute Show
description: Mr. E. Minx's 90's drag series pays tribute to Hole, featuring performances by Nxthing, Klondyke, Caresse Deville, and Poly Ester, with music by Miss Woman the Woman.

title: 28th Urbanworld Film Festival
description: A film festival showcasing various films at Regal Union Square and Film at Lincoln Center.
address: Regal Union Square and Film at Lincoln Center, New York, NY

title: 15th DOC NYC
description: A documentary film festival taking place at various venues including IFC Center and SVA Theatre.
address: IFC Center, SVA Theatre, Village East by Angelika, and online

title: 18th Annual Korean American Film Festival New York
description: A film festival showcasing Korean American films at Hunter College and Sugar Mouse.
address: Hunter College and Sugar Mouse, New York, NY

title: Kenny Scharf Exhibition
description: A major survey of artist Kenny Scharf at The Brant Foundation, featuring over 70 works from the late 1970s to present.
address: The Brant Foundation, East Village, NY
